eu_initiatives:
Our members monitor the EU affairs with the aim of spreading the most relevant information among the citizens through our web-pages ( mainly through the web-site, the blog and twitter ). 
 
Furthermore, we are currently following these on going or recently completed topics and procedures: 
 
- - Investing in Europe’s Youth 
 
- Economic growth and youth employment  
 
- Where is the EP? Lack of democracy within the structured dialogue in the field of Youth. 
 
 
General Issues 
We are currently studying the evolution of the european governance and the means to enforce the participative means to the decision making process. We are interested to any kind of information coming from the EU which can effect directly the life of the citizens and according our statutory aim we inform them our we-pages and social media.  
We kindly invite all our audience to visit our website www.europe-hopes.eu and our blog which includes more contents: beready4eu.blogspot.be 
After our recent contribute to the Erasmus+ project M.e.d.e.u.y.m. (http://beready4eu.blogspot.it/2016/10/different-dreamers-young-europeans.html) we are focused our attention on dialogue between Young people and policy makers a te EU level. The lack of involvement of the European Parliament within the structured dialogue process is a breach in the Youth participative rights. 
In 2016 we have been also partner in the spanish project, funded by the Erasmus Plus programme, "Step out of your mind" (training for Youth workers) and in 2017 we have been partner in the project I.T.Y.I. - International training for Youth integration within which we have been the responsible of the training modules on EU Affairs and social inclusion.

relevant_communication:
Europe HOpes is strongly committed to a European active citizenship.EHO believes that youth political participation (and in principle, the political participation of all the EU citizens) may be enhanced by non-formal education, which has a strong potential in shaping the knowledge, skills and aptitudes of people in getting politically involved at EU level.   
 
Our main activities are information campaigns about EU governance and affairs, addressing especially to young EU citizens.  
 
Currently, we are focused on youth empowerment, as intended by the Trio Presidency (Italy, Latvia, and Luxembourg) for July 2014 - December 2015. Our permanent project “Be Ready 4 EU”  responds to the question: "Are u ready 4 European Union?". The aim of Project "Be ready 4 EU" is to make young people aware of the meaning of being a European citizen. 
In fact we engage young citizens in civic volunteering, encouraging them to have their say on EU affairs, also favouring and encouraging contacts with European policy makers, asking them to take in consideration the youth opinion. They also be encouraged to express their own opinion as observers and citizens and make it known to the decision makers. So, joining the debate young EU citizens will better understand the real meaning of the EU democracy.  
 
The participants are engaged in a strong communication campaign which is focused on the central message to "be ready for the EU", addressing as target group other young people. Our communication strategy is based on the methodology based on "youth to youth communication".  
 
On our blog, the main EU debates (from the European Parliament representing the citizens directly) are reported in a clear and comprehensive language for young EU citizens who knows little about the EU issues. 
We also stimulate the contacts with MEPs in a way to get them closer to the citizens (here you can find a sample: http://www.europe-hopes.eu/News/art/9/belgian-liberal-mep-philippe-de-backer-optimistic-about-europes-future-despite-atmosphere-of-crisis)  
 
In summary during the years 2014-2015 our activities have had two specific objectives:1)improving the offer of communication on EU affairs for the European young citizens;2)empowering young citizens, encouraging their participation within the EU debates.  
 
It is worth remarking our main outcomes of 2016: 
 
Partners of the Erasmus+ KA1 project "Step out of your mind) Lead Association Prorise Spain. 
 
Facilitator and training provider for the KA3 project. M.E.D.E.U.Y.M. www.medeuym.eu 
 
- Main outcomes of 2016: 
- June: EHO received the accreditation n. 2015-1-IT03-KA110-005849 as sending organization within the Erasmus+ - KA1 - "European Voluntary Service". 
 
- On october 21-22 attended : Gioventù Italiana, la scommessa sei tu! on the themes of youth participation and the networking of associations and informal groups of young people (organised by Ag. Naz. Giovani). 
 
- Our "Be Ready 4 EU" session in Brussels (november-dicember) permitted to a group of 10 young people to have their say on EU matters and contacting and interviewing some MEPs  or members of the Commission. More than this our activities have had the merit to reach more than new 1500 readers and interactions through our blog and the other social media.  
 
- On dicember 4th we have held a relevant round-table "Terrorism in the EU. What are the effects of the latest Paris attacks on the EU policies?", with which we have stimulated young people to have their say on the matter. A position paper will be published within january 2016 (key messages on twitter: @europehopes). 
 
In the following years 2016-2017 we will enforce our advocacy activity focused on youth rights with a deeper commitment in proposing new tools (or developing the existing ones) aimed to streghten the civic participation of the young european citizens.
